reviews.text: As a young family, we were looking for an easy getaway for the Canada Day long weekend. Something where we could stay on the resort the entire time, and have lots to do. After some research, we chose Blue Mountain, and it turned out to be the perfect choice.
reviews.title: Fabulous family destination

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At first, booking accomodations via the Blue Mountain website was somewhat confusing. What I finally pieced together is that if you want to stay in the heart of the village (and we did), you are basically given two choices: Mosaic or Village. What took more digging to find out is that "Village" is actually made up of three separate hotels, Grand Georgian, Weider Lodge, and Seasons. If you choose Village, you aren't given a choice online of which specific hotel you'd like to book. You have to call Blue Mountain to make that request if that matters to you.
reviews.title: A great place to spend the weekend - free underground parking

reviews.text: In the end, we chose to go with Mosaic since it's the newest and the pictures appealed to us the most. It was a great choice. We got free underground parking, check-in and check-out was a breeze, the pool was beautiful, and the suite was very modern. We had a one-bedroom suite with a kitchenette, which had a stovetop, but no oven (#313). It was clean, spotless, and suited our family of 3 perfectly. We also had a village view, which I personally preferred to a pool view. It was nice to sit out on the balcony at night, have a drink, and watch the action go by.
reviews.title: Clean and updated accommodations in a great setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We kept our 5 year old amused very easily. We spent hours in the pool every day, swimming 2-3 times daily. When we went early in the morning, we had the pool to ourselves 3 days out of 4. Pool towels were large and abundant, save for Canada Day, when things got a bit too busy in the afternoon and we had to wait for towels to be laundered and brought out.
reviews.title: Ok...Not worth the price...

reviews.text: Though swimming was popular, we tried a few other activities as well. We rode the Gondola ($4 each adult, kids 5 and under are free), rented a peddle boat ($15 for 30 minutes), and rode the Ridge Runner rollercoaster ($20 for one adult and one child). All fun! In the Events Plaza, they had performers and all kinds of activities set up for kids. Our daughter made a shrinky-dink necklace, her own bouncy ball, got to visit and touch a number of exotic animals, blew giant bubbles, and enjoyed the fountain-turned-splashpad.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Ski Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been going to Collingwood every weekend for the past 10 years and I do not usually stay in a hotel. My boyfriend wanted to book a room for us and I had never heard of Mosaic, I was just happy it was right in the village. When we got to our room I was so pleasantly surprised at how large and clean it was! I wish we stayed for longer to use all of the amenities in the hotel, but the room alone was excellent in my opinion. Much bigger than a room for the same price at the Grand Georgian, and everything is pretty new. Large bathroom, fireplace, kitchen stuff. Both of us had an amazing stay and I cannot wait to stay there again!
reviews.title: Great Rooms, Great Stay!

reviews.text: We enjoyed our 2 bedroom condo with full kitchen on the 4th floor. The balcony overlooked the pool area. A king and a queen bed, 2 full baths and a roomy living area make enough space for a small family - or two couples. There is a sofa bed in the living area as well, so for those wanting to go Dutch - you can here.
reviews.title: The basis is there - now step up the service a notch

reviews.text: Check in procedure worked well for us - not for the family we were travelling with. First night we looked at the outdoor hot tub and noted people smoking in it, dring beer (even from bottles!). When I asked at the front desk if they allowed smoking in the hot tub - the answer was: Not really, but no further action was taken. The pool was too cold on the first two nights - then closed two nights for repairs - we did not check after but more people were swimming.
reviews.title: Blue Mountain- Mosaic - Don't expect to sleep well

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Underground parking is nice - and was not charged. The entrance though is not kept clear of snow.
reviews.title: excellent time-we will be back!!!

reviews.text: It was quite noisy when we stayed (week leading up to Christmas) - a bit more soundproofing to the hallways would have been nice.
reviews.title: Could be better....

reviews.text: We stayed at Mosaic for 3 nights in August 2010. We had a good trip inspite of the service. On night one, we informed the front desk that the pool water was green and had an infestation of bugs. She informed me these things happen, it's an outdoor pool. Well, the next day, the pool was shut for 24 hours. The reason we went to Mosaic was for the kids to swim. We paid extra for a poolside room. Front desk told us it was no big deal, that the pool was only down for 24 hours and that they needed to clean it for their guest on the long wind. So, at this stage, we were clearly unwanted second rate guests. An offer of 10% off of one night's stay and complimentary late check out was weak. Finally, the Mosaic workers smoking in a family section right beside my kids was enough. We will never stay at Mosaic again and would highly recommend avoiding this hotel.
reviews.title: VERY POOR SERVICE--AVOID MOSAIC

reviews.text: We booked 2 days at the Mosaic after a lot of internet searches (in particular using Trip Advisor) for the Collingwood/Wasaga Beach area. After a horribel experience at another establishment located in Parry Sound, we added an extra night on very short notice. We had booked a one-bedroom condo with a King-sized bed "preference" (they do not guarantee bed choices - my only real complaint about the place). The cost was approximately $250 first night with a gradual decline in price for each additional night = total for 3 nights was aproximately $680.00 (tax in). The prices can fluctuate here due to the private ownership of the condos; however, once booked the price is the price. You could likely get a better deal if you do not book on short notice.
reviews.title: Great Stay - Front Desk Staff A Pleasure (Especially Heather)!

reviews.text: We arrived around 6p.m. or so frazzled from the bad experience we had earlier that day. The young lady at the front desk, "Heather", was an absolute pleasure to deal with - bright, articulate, efficient and understanding of our needs. We relayed our earlier experience to her. Lucky for us, a King-size bed was available in 2 of the remaining condo suites. Once checked in, we went to our assigned room. However, we left right away as it was located right beside the elevator and you could hear it moving up and down and dinging. Heather changed our room right away with no questions asked. Our final destination was a lovely little one bedroom condo. It was clean (except for the stray hair in the tub) and comfortable. The view was of the parking lot outside and the tennis dome; however, if you looked beyond that there was a panoramic view of the lake. The room had all of the amenities described to us and had pretty good soundproofing. Be forewarned that you can not turn off the air conditionning!
reviews.title: Resort Good....Service Poor

reviews.text: Shortly after our arrival at our final destination, a bottle of shiraz with some local chocolates were sent up to our room with a note saying "Have a relaxing vacation". We knew right away that this had come from Heather! Now, this might be standard for this hotel; however, it was a delightful surprise!
reviews.title: A fine stay at Mosaic...

reviews.text: Mosaic is located in The Village (part of the Blue Mountain Resort), so there is a lot of nearby shopping, restaurants and little things to entertain adults and children alike. Our hotel was very family friendly, so if you mind hearing kids running up and down the halls, then this place is not for you! The underground parking is apparently free in the summertime - a nice bonus! The restaurant attached to the Mosaic serves an excellent and hearty breakfast!
reviews.title: Mosiac at Blue Mountain--A Lovely Family Weekend!

reviews.text: The most comfortable hotel ever! This was like living at home. My family and extended family loved this place and we are definitely coming back next summer. W stayed at the Mosiac the last week of August and the kids had a blast. We had a two bedroom townhome with 2 1/2 bathrooms and a FULL kitchen with a patio and BBQ. It was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom were clean and the rooms were exceptional. There was not even that typical "hotel" smell to complain about. My kids 5 & 3 loved the pool (better than plunge), playing outside during the day and evening. My extended family also loved their room which was similar to mine and I know that this will be a summer destination tradition that we will continue every year. Although there were annoying bees in the area and everywhere you walked in Blue Mountain, it was a perfect summer getaway for the adults and kids.
reviews.title: Just like home!!

reviews.text: This was our third 'annual' trip to Blue Mountain, staying at Mosaic.
reviews.title: We love Mosaic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Each year we have had a 2 bedroom unit. The first year was a different configuration from 2010 and 2011.
reviews.title: Not the worst ever, but insultingly bad due to the price.

reviews.text: We had the 2 bedroom loft. On the main floor was a kitchen/dining room/living room combination. Also a bedroom and full bathroom. The loft had a bedroom and full bathroom.
reviews.title: Great room and the mountain is fun in the summer too!

reviews.text: It was spotlessly clean, perfect amount of room for my husband, 2 sons and myself.
reviews.title: $1396 down the toilet
